page.title: 07CHILDREN'S GAMES, HOCKLIFFE
page.content: We talked to the children at the{Lower {School}and they told us some of the games they played at breaktime. The games are varied. {Hopscotch, Horses {and Football}are popular though there are no skipping games. There is a {climbing frame}in the playground but the children are only allowed on it if there is a teacher present. Games lessons are mixed due to small numbers. The sports played are {Netball, Hockey and Rounders.} After school the children of Hockliffe play {Polo, Hide and Seek and Tag.}Some children ride their bikes at the park. Others prefer to play on their computers. On Monday evenings, at the village hall, the{Youth Club}takes place. At the club you can{roller {skate, play snooker, breakdance}and {listen to records. }Once a week{ Cubs and{Brownies}meet in the village.
